translation.text: Route 111 detour

Route 111 detoured beginning at the start of service on Saturday, May 26, and continuing until further notice due to construction on Washington Avenue between Bellingham Square and Carey Avenue.

Outbound: Connect at Hawthorne St @ Broadway or Washington Ave @ Cary Ave.
Inbound: Connect at Washington Ave @ Bloomingdale St or Washington Ave @ Broadway.

Bypassed stops:
City Hall @ Broadway (outbound)
Washington Ave @ Crescent Ave (outbound)
125 Washington Ave opp Orange St (outbound)
Washington Ave @ Heard St (inbound)
Washington Ave @ Chestnut St (inbound)
Change at Downtown Crossing

Downtown Crossing: The Franklin St entrance will be closed on Monday, August 10, and will remain closed until Summer 2016 to accommodate ongoing construction for the Millennium Tower Project.

Customers desiring to enter and exit at Downtown Crossing should instead utilize entrances and exits on Summer, Chauncy, and Arch Streets. 

Customers desiring elevator access should note that Elevator 891 will be closed during this construction. If exiting, travel down the concourse to use the elevator through the glass doors and to the left of the CharlieCard Store. This elevator will take you to the lobby of 101 Arch Street. If boarding, travel to 101 Arch Street. Take the elevator in the back left corner of the lobby to the concourse. Take a right to find the Oak Grove-bound platform ahead. Customers can also enter and exit the station using the Roche Bros. elevator on Summer St. (during store hours only).

Affected routes:
Orange Line
Red Line (Ashmont branch)
Red Line (Braintree
elevator unavailable

Elevator 891 DOWNTOWN CROSSING - Oak Grove-bound platform to Franklin and Washington Streets is unavailable Monday, August 10, until Summer 2016 to accommodate ongoing construction for the Millennium Tower Project.

If exiting, travel down the concourse to use the elevator through the glass doors and to the left of the CharlieCard Store. This elevator will take you to the lobby of 101 Arch Street. If boarding, travel to 101 Arch Street. Take the elevator in the back left corner of the lobby to the concourse. Take a right to find the Oak Grove-bound platform ahead.

Customers can also enter and exit the station using the Roche Bros. elevator on Summer St. (during store hours only).
elevator unavailable

Elevator 939 COURTHOUSE - Lobby to the south headhouse on Seaport Blvd is unavailable beginning Monday, October 5, until Fall 2016 due to the Yotel Hotel Development.

Please use Courthouse Elevator 940 to exit/enter Courthouse. This elevator is located on the opposite side of the lobby. At the street, cross Seaport Boulevard to use Courthouse Elevator 940.
Silver Line - SL1 and Silver Line - SL2 notice

Beginning at the start of service on Monday, October 5, Courthouse Station's south entrance/exit will be closed until Fall 2016 due to the Yotel Hotel Development.

Due to the construction of the Yotel Hotel Development, the south entrance/exit at Courthouse Station will be closed from Monday, October 5, 2015, until Fall 2016. To exit/enter the station, please use the north entrance across the street. 

Also please note that Courthouse Elevator 939 will be unavailable during this time. Customers desiring elevator access should use Courthouse Elevator 940 to exit/enter Courthouse. This elevator is located on the opposite side of the lobby. At the street, cross Seaport Boulevard to use Courthouse Elevator 940.
B St @ W 6th St closed

The following stops are closed temporarily beginning Thursday, November 19 due to construction: B Street @ West 6th Street (outbound). Please board at B Street @ West 5th Street.

Affected routes:
11
Routes 230 and 236 notice
Bus Routes 230 and 236 will pick up at berth 7 in the outer busway at Braintree Station from 6:00 AM to 2:30 PM beginning Mon Nov 23 due to construction.
Green Line and Orange Line notice

Green Line and Orange Line Notice: Beginning Saturday, January 2, 2016, North Station's north entrance/exit will be permanently closed.

Due to construction of the Boston Garden Development, the Orange and Green Line's north entrance/exit at North Station will be closed permanently starting Saturday, January 2, 2016. A new underground passageway will be constructed in order to provide customers with a direct connection between the Green Line, Orange Line, and Commuter Rail. The new passageway will open in approximately three years.

To exit and enter North Station, please use the entrance/exit across Causeway Street. 
 
During this time, North Station Elevator 941 will be closed. If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). If boarding, cross Causeway Street to use North Station Elevator 912
elevator unavailable

Elevator 941 NORTH STATION - Lobby to the Commuter Rail and Boston Garden will be closed beginning Saturday, January 2, 2016, until further notice due to construction of the Boston Garden Development.

If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). If boarding, cross Causeway Street to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to street) or travel one-tenth of a mile down Haverhill Street to the entrance located at the intersection of Haverhill Street and Valenti Way.

Suspension of service on Green Line

Green Line suspended in both directions between Park Street and Haymarket on Feb 20-21 and March 5-6 from start to end of service. Trains will not operate between Park Street and Haymarket.

Due to MBTA crews performing necessary track and signal work as well as the Government Center Project, Green Line service will be suspended between Park St. and Haymarket in both directions from start to end of service during the following weekends: 

- Saturday, February 20, 2016, through Sunday, February 21, 2016.
- Saturday, March 5, 2016, through Sunday, March 6, 2016.

Inbound (eastbound) trains will terminate at Park St. and outbound (westbound) trains will terminate at Haymarket. 

For customers desiring westbound Green Line service beyond Haymarket, transfer to Forest Hills-bound Orange Line service at either North Station or Haymarket. Exit at Downtown Crossing and use the Winter Street Concourse to Park St. for access to the Green Line.

For customers desiring eastbound Green
Suspension of service on Green Line

Green Line suspended in both directions between Park and Haymarket beginning at approx 8:45 p.m. on Feb 23, approx 11 p.m. on Feb 22 and 24, and approx 10 p.m. on Feb 25. Trains will not operate between Park and Haymarket.

Due to the Government Center Project, Green Line service will be suspended between Park and Haymarket in both directions beginning at approximately 8:45 p.m. through the end of service on the following days:

- Monday, February 22, 2016 (after the conclusion of the Bruins game, approx 11 p.m.-12 a.m.).
- Tuesday, February 23, 2016.
- Wednesday, February 24, 2016 (after the conclusion of the Celtics game, approx 11 p.m.).
- Thursday, February 25, 2016 (after the conclusion of the Celtics game, approx 10 p.m.).

Inbound (eastbound) trains will terminate at Park and outbound (westbound) trains will terminate at Haymarket. 

For customers desiring westbound Green Line service beyond Haymarket, transfer to Forest Hills-bound Orange Line service at either North
Centre St @ Roseway moved

Bowdoin closed

Bowdoin will be closed beginning at approximately 8:45 p.m. through the end of service on Feb 28-Mar 2. Please board and exit the Blue Line at State Street during the closure.

Due to crews performing necessary work as part of Government Center Project, Bowdoin Station will be closed beginning at approximately 8:45 p.m. through the end of service on the following days:

- Sunday, February 28, 2016.
- Monday, February 29, 2016.
- Tuesday, March 1, 2016.
- Wednesday, March  2, 2016.

During this time, Blue Line service will terminate/originate at State Street Station. For westbound service, please exit at State Street and travel at the street-level to Bowdoin. For eastbound service, please travel at the street-level to State Street in order to board the Blue Line. Bowdoin will re-open at the start of service the following day.  

A single train will operate between State Street outbound and Maverick outbound. Customers desiring service towards State Street will need transfer

Haverhill Line notice: The mini-high platform at Andover Station is out of service. A portable lift is available.

Affected stops:
Andover
Commuter Rail notice

Reminder: Monday, February 22, is the final day to provide feedback at mbta.com for proposed Commuter Rail schedule changes.

Please visit http://www.mbta.com/about_the_mbta/public_meetings or click the link below and select the appropriate option to provide feedback on the schedule changes. Passengers should provide their feedback using the online Customer Comment form.
Mattapan Trolley shuttle

Buses replacing Mattapan Trolley from Ashmont to Mattapan Stations in both directions from start to end of service on Saturday, March 19, through Sunday, March 20, due to the Neponset River Greenway Project.

Due to crews performing necessary work as part of the Neponset River Greenway Project, buses will replace Mattapan Trolley service between Ashmont and Mattapan Stations in both directions from start to end of service beginning Saturday, March 19, 2016, through Sunday, March 20, 2016.

Regular Mattapan Trolley service will resume at the start of service on Monday, March 21, 2016. All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Shuttling the following stops: 
Ashmont
Cedar Grove
Butler
Milton
Central Ave.
Valley Road
Capen Street
Mattapan
Red Line shuttle

Buses replacing Red Line service between Alewife and Harvard Square Stations on March 26-27 as well as April 2-3, 9-10, and 23-24 from start to end of service.

Due to the Floating Slab Project, buses will replace Red Line trains between Alewife and Harvard Square Stations in both directions from start to end of service during the following weekends:

- Saturday, March 26, 2016, through Sunday, March 27, 2016.
- Saturday, April 2, 2016, through Sunday, April 3, 2016. 
- Saturday, April 9, 2016, through Sunday, April 10, 2016. 
- Saturday, April 23, 2016, through Sunday, April 24, 2016.

Regular Red Line train service will resume at the start of service on Mondays. All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Shuttling the following stops:
Alewife
Davis
Porter
Harvard

Fitchburg Line shuttle

All Fitchburg Line trains will be suspended between Fitchburg and Littleton/Route 495 on Saturday, February 27, and Sunday, February 28, with shuttle buses provided.

Due to ongoing signal construction activity in Shirley, service will be suspended and replaced with alternate shuttle bus service between Fitchburg and Littleton/Route 495 Stations in both directions on the following dates:

- Saturday, February 27, 2016
- Sunday, February 28, 2016

Outbound Fitchburg Line service will terminate at Littleton/Route 495 Station where passengers can connect with shuttle buses to Ayer, Shirley, North Leominster, and Fitchburg Stations. Passengers desiring Inbound Fitchburg Line service from Fitchburg, North Leominster, Shirley, or Ayer Stations must board shuttle buses to Littleton/Route 495 for inbound Commuter Rail connections. There will be no ski train connection to/from Wachusett Mountain. Passengers should allow additional travel time, anticipating delays of approximately twenty
Change at Braintree

Braintree Garage construction beginning Monday, February 22, 2016, through August 2016, causing diminished parking availability.

Braintree Garage construction will occur in phases with one or multiple aspects of the garage affected depending on the phase. 
 
Parking Availability: 
Braintree Garage reaches capacity daily at approximately 7:30 a.m. Customers are advised to proceed to Quincy Adams or North Quincy for increased chances of locating available parking spaces Monday through Friday.
 
Pick Up/Drop Off Traffic Pattern:
Customers are advised to follow construction detour signs in order to access the current passenger pick up/drop off area. Customers can access the Garage and the pick up/drop off area from Union Street on the ramp from the Route 3 rotary.
 
Premium Parking Spaces:
All premium parkers must use the Union Street entrance on the ramp from the Route 3 rotary and follow construction signs to maneuver into premium spaces.
 
Accessibility:
During this phase
